title: YOU HAVE POI!!!
nextSteps: Do not get healthcare on this app.
You can still access our resources.

title: You may be perimenopausal.
desc: Based on your answers, you are likely in premenopause or perimenopause. Perimenopause is the phase leading up to menopause. This is when your body's level of estrogen fluctuates, which can cause menopausal symptoms and changes in your periods.
symptoms: Mood changes like irritability or anxiety
nextSteps: Learn More: Explore resources to understand your symptoms.
Talk to a Specialist: Get advice on managing symptoms and treatment options.
Track Symptoms: Keep a log to spot patterns and share with your provider.

title: You may be in perimenopause but have abnormal bleeding.
desc: Based on your answers, you are likely in perimenopause, the phase leading up to menopause. This is when your body's level of estrogen fluctuates, which can cause menopausal symptoms and changes in your periods. Before seeking care from a specialist on our platform, it is important to have abnormal bleeding investigated by your doctor.
symptoms: Mood changes like irritability or anxiety
nextSteps: Learn More: Explore resources to understand your symptoms.
Track Symptoms: Keep a log to spot patterns and share with your provider.

title: You are in perimenopause.
desc: Based on your answers, you are likely in perimenopause. Perimenopause is the phase leading up to menopause. This is when your body's level of estrogen fluctuates, which can cause menopausal symptoms and changes in your periods.
symptoms: Mood changes like irritability or anxiety
nextSteps: Learn More: Explore resources to understand your symptoms.

title: You are in menopause.
desc: Based on your answers, you are in menopause. This is when the ovaries are no longer functioning and your body's level of estrogen significantly decreases. The loss of estrogen can cause menopausal symptoms and periods to stop.
symptoms: Mood changes like irritability or anxiety
nextSteps: Learn More: Explore resources to understand your symptoms.
Talk to a Specialist: Get advice on managing symptoms and treatment options.
Track Symptoms: Keep a log to spot patterns and share with your provider.

title: You are likely in perimenopause or menopause.
desc: Based on your answers, you are likely in perimenopause or menopause. Perimenopause is the phase leading up to menopause. This is when your body's level of estrogen fluctuates, which can cause menopausal symptoms. It may be hard to know when your menopause is/was because you have had a hysterectomy.
symptoms: Mood changes like irritability or anxiety
nextSteps: Learn More: Explore resources to understand your symptoms.
Talk to a Specialist: Get advice on managing symptoms and treatment options.
